alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Crowley County; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 11:34PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern El Paso, northwestern Crowley and northeastern Pueblo Counties through 1215 AM MDT... At 1131 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles southeast of Truckton to near Hanover. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hanover and open country of southeastern El Paso, northwestern Crowley and northeastern Pueblo Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
